page.title: 01Geography
page.content: { { }Cwmtwrch is a long straggling village of about 3.5 miles in length,ranging from the village of Ystalyfera in the South to Cwmllynfell in the North-West. On the West side of the valley are high precipitous rocks rising in places about 300 feet sheer from the bed of the River Twrch.These rocks lead to the hills of Allt-y-Grug and the heights of Gwrhyd. The Eastern side,in the lower part of the valley is far more undulating,the gradual rise leading to the bleak moorland of Palleg and later to the Black Mountains 2,000 feet above sea level.
